Reviews.Title: Take good care of it.
Reviews.Author: Cyan "Lulipop"
Reviews.Content: You have to baby this thing if you want it to weather all.  Dont change battery or sd card out on the beach or anywhere where particles can get in.  make sure to keep the seals clean so clean after a day of rugged use.  Make sure the flimsy door is clicked shut so it remains water proof.  Do not use it in pounding surf.  If you blow it clean after ever use and wipe it, this camera can last you a long time.  It takes amazing photos and the telephoto makes for very interesting shots.  If you want a rugged camera this could fit the bill... but you HAVE to be careful with it. And it really makes sense to do these things anyway.  Even if you dont open the compartment on the beach small bits will get into chamber somehow so blow it clean with canned air.  Green I think is best color.  ( :

Reviews.Title: Did what it was meant to do
Reviews.Author: kitkat39
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because I usually abuse my other ones.  At first I was afraid I had made a mistake because of the bad reviews, but the pictures came out fairly well and so did the video mode.  I've got other point and shoot cameras such as the Canon SD750 and that is completely thrashed now since it's always in my pocket when I'm sober OR drunk.  I've also got a Canon S95, which I was just too scared of getting messed up when I take out with me or go underwater, even with the expensive underwater case. The xp20 isn't the best when it comes to shooting indoors.. actually I don't like the quality at all when the room is a bit dark, but outside with natural lighting and under the water it will do the job.  Just make sure the seals are all locked in place and I don't think it will be a problem. Other cameras that I have used usually require a big hunky underwater case which is actually a bit embarrassing to carry around, but that's another great thing about this camera.In a dark room, this camera isn't so great.  Outside in nature, this camera does it's job.

Reviews.Title: May be good for a throw-around camera but NOT a underwater device
Reviews.Author: Flip
Reviews.Content: The camera lasted 3.5 snorkeling trips then its waterproof function turned to a waterlogged function. I had read the reviews and brought an old camera as a backup on our trip to Cozumel. This camera may be great for motorcycle trips where it may get a little rain on it from time to time, but as for a underwater camera don't wast your time. It took okay pictures outside but inside like many reviews said the images are yellowed and washed out.NOT ANY GOOD FOR SNORKELING IT WILL WATER-LOG AFTER A FEW TRIPS OUT.

Reviews.Title: If you are going to take it under water.....
Reviews.Author: gottaread1
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for two weeks. Before I bought it I read all of the other reviews.  It seemed like the biggest complaint was water leaking into the camera. So I played with the battery compartment (where most people said it leaked) and I could create a condition where the case would appear to be locked but not completely.  Bottom line I found was to push the cover closed hard, with two thumbs AND LISTEN FOR A LOUD CLICK!  Make sure one of your thumbs is not on the release lever when closing the door. Experiment closing the door many times before taking it under water. I was even able to get a tiny click out of closing the battery door and it was not securely latched!  Make sure you get a loud click. If you let anyone borrow this camera educate them on this feature.  So far I have not had any troubles with this camera and I am enjoying it. Thank you all of the other reviewers that alerted me to the battery door closing issue.

Reviews.Title: Works as designed...
Reviews.Author: Jared G Buletza
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip to Turkey.  It worked great.  I used the panorama view to take some scenic pictures and they came out great.  I also snorkeled in the Aegean sea with it a handful of times.Notes:- The waterproofing worked fine for me.  I did notice that you have to pay attention when closing the battery cover on the side.  Because it is making a water-tight seal, you do have to really push it and make sure that it "locks".  I would expect this for any water proof camera.- I did notice that the "GPS when camera is on" really drains the camera battery.. but if you disable the GPS, you should get plenty of battery life.- I would also recommend the bright yellow "chums" camera float.  the first time out.. I swam to shore, and discovered that my camera came out of my pockets.  (my pockets were not good in my shorts).. but I did see my "chum" floating out in the water.. so I was able to swim out and get my camera.- I don't know what to tell you about the other people that had problems.. maybe its just hard to build a water proof camera?  or maybe they didn't do something right and didn't realize it.  but mine works great, as does my friends' which is the previous year's model.

Reviews.Title: New Fujifilm FinePix XP20 camera purchased through Amazon.com
Reviews.Author: kaybear
Reviews.Content: I love my new Fujifilm FinePix camera.  I have owned several Olympus cameras both 35 mm and digital.  I was looking for a new one that had certain features.  As I searched for the latest Olypus models a list came up and the Fujifilm Finepix  appeard on the list so I checked it out.  I liked the features and decided to order the green one.  I am very happy with the camera so far.  I know there are lots of features I haven't tapped into yet but plan to do some more practice.  I just returned from a vacation and used my camera on auto.  I was extremely happy with the ease of use and the results of the pictures, especially the movie feature.  The easy record button is much better than having to stop to change mode settings on my previous camera.  I have not tried the water proof feature (under water) but was near a waterfall spray with no problems or worries of affecting my picture taking.  So far so good.  Nice size and easy to carry.

Reviews.Title: Excellent waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: kattanfan07
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting a waterproof camera for a while now. I finally got serious about researching cameras and stumbled upon this little beauty. After reading such mixed reviews, I was a little hesitant about purchasing the camera but I did anyway. Let me just say that I am so glad I did! The price was what attracted me to the camera in the first place. I've only had the camera for a week but I've taken it to the Florida Springs, the pool, the beach, and fishing and have had great photos for a point and shoot. I also own a Canon SLR camera and do wedding/portrait photography on the side so I know what good quality photos look like. This camera gives great quality for it's price range and for being such a versatile camera.I'd recommend this camera to anyone. I also ordered the floating strap on Amazon and am waiting for it to come in the mail (better safe than sorry).

Reviews.Title: Learn to read instructions
Reviews.Author: Albert Noel Miller "big al"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I bought this camera at Costco when it was on sale. Took it on several trips , one to New Mexico and Las Vegas. Wealso take it to the river when fly fishing. Never had any problem of any kind. I dove into the swimming pool and took a video of my wife diving in and it looks pretty good to me. Never leaked and shok proof is underestimated. It meets all the demands we put on it. I DID read the instructions hiowever and made sure the battery/SD Card slot covers were properly latched befere going into the water. Never leaked or went dead. The battery life is as good as the Cannon I had prior to this one. The battery charger is compact and can be carried in a purse or other bag without geting in the way and can be used in any 110 vold outlet. The night photos are a bit grainy if not set to the right mode. If the photos are too grainy or turn out poorly then set it to the right mode and, oh, guess what, you may need a tripod like almost any other camera taking night or low light photos. We will keep it and I am getting ready to order my Daughter one also. I do have two other friends that purchased this camera and they have no complaints either!!

Reviews.Title: great underwater camera
Reviews.Author: M. WHITE "navigator"
Reviews.Content: Just make sure you close the door fully.  The little clasp will click and show black, not yellow when it is fully closed.  Probably best to not open at at the beach so no sand gets in the seal.  If you are a little careful, it will last a couple of years, at least.  Its not a $700 camera, but with a little care it will sure take pictures like one.  I bought an extra battery, but it lasts a long time.  160 bucks for mine, went up a little since then.

Reviews.Title: Audio is out-of-sync
Reviews.Author: H. Wang "jwangamazon"
Reviews.Content: I got the Fuji XP20 mainly for taking videos in conditions that my Canon HD camcorder can not. On my first usage in a river rafting event, I already see the problems with this camera:1) I am experienced with Camera and camcorders, I know how to hold them properly. But the lens head is placed in a very awkward place, your fingers will easily cover part of the lens head. So, don't be surprised to see your fingers in the final photos and video clips. It's almost for sure that you will not get photos or videos of yourself. Because other people may not be able to hold this camera properly to take yours.2) Hard to fine tune the zoom speed. Not convenient, but I can live with that.3) The camera won't focus while zooming (it will focus after zooming stops). This is a typical issue with non-DSLR camera in video mode. I saw the same thing in Panasonic camera also. Not a big issue to me.4) This is the biggest flaw, the audio is not in sync with the video. I have to turn off the audio from the video clips, and add background music when producing the final movie for the rafting trip. Even my simple Flip video camera handle this better than this Fuji camera.5) The video quality is no way to compare with regular HD camcorder. The image is kind of grainy, even at 1pm strong sunshine with good light. Again, I can accept this since I am in a condition (around water) where normal camcorder can not be used.6) Indoor photo quality is no way to compare with my 5-year-old 5MP Panasonic camera.But this is OK to me since I am in a condition (around water) where my normal camera can not be used.If this is the only camera you want to have, I won't recommend this. However, if your intend is "ONLY" to take photos, videos in conditions where your normal gears can not, then I think this Fuju XP20 is acceptable....if you don't mind the out-of-sync audio problem.

Reviews.Title: great underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Melissa Lillvis
Reviews.Content: amazing camera. i took it on my honeymoon to hawai'i. we snorkled every day and this camera was able to capture the beautiful underwater scenes without issue. if i could give this camera more than 5 stars i would!

Reviews.Title: FujiFilm XP20
Reviews.Author: D. Rasmussen
Reviews.Content: I could not be more happy with this camera.  I have had it in the water twice and have gotten some neat videos.  Quality is very good for an inexpensive camera.  On auto it is a little overexposed outside in full sun but change to the sunlight setting and your good to go.  Don't expect a top of the line Cannon but a great camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Good camera not problems
Reviews.Author: Pete'ee
Reviews.Content: works well,fast between shots, flash is good for normal night shots. used at the beach and pool area on a 7 day cruise.no problems with it at all. great underwater shots of wife swimming under water.  has underwater mode to help take great picures. the only negative thing i would even say about this camera is you have to make sure to push the on button good, I guess it is part of the waterproofing. Buy it and you will enjoy it, take it to the beach, snow, sand all will be good.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Sandy
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera as a replacement for our older waterproof camera when we were in Hawaii. We are very happy with it. We have had it over a year and have taken it snorkeling, fishing and skiing. It's small, compact and easy to use. Be sensible, and don't open it in the water, or on a sandy beach. Be careful with the door, and you'll have a great camera that will last a long time. We are happy with the quality of the pictures both in and out of the water. The telephoto feature is a real plus when around shy fish. We bought an extra battery. The only thing that is a pain is the location of the lens. Some of our pictures have fingers in them =)

Reviews.Title: Didn't make it to the water
Reviews.Author: Kirby Bjostad
Reviews.Content: Never even made it in the water... I don't know any about ISO's or "noise" in a picture but I had to take 3 for one to come out OKAY indoors, with what I would call medium light and the flash on.

Reviews.Title: It's not as great as it sounds
Reviews.Author: Lily
Reviews.Content: I did some research of the xp20 to be ready for black friday/cyber monday deals. I was really excited about this camera due to it's many options for scenes and the automatic scene recognition setting. I have used my camera more often than not in low-level lighting settings, usually at venues, parties and shows. I use the video setting to record my boyfriend's bands when they play (in clubs, theatres and bars). I have been EXTREMELY disappointed by how the low level light pictures come out and the "HD" movie quality. Maybe it's great quality video in perfectly lit settings but so far all I've gotten is fairly grainy video with REALLY TERRIBLE sound quality. Like, really really bad.  And with the simple point and click photos, I've tried every setting on the darn thing to try and get a good picture for low level light, for example the work party I was just at, dinner was in a ballroom with electric candle chandeliers. Couldn't get a nice picture for the life of me. Every setting turned out horrible pictures.Summary: with prime lighting you can probably get great pictures, video sound quality is HORRID, video picture quality, again must have prime lighting.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre camera
Reviews.Author: Zoe C. Johnson "genday"
Reviews.Content: I had an olympus tough before I got this camera to replace it (I loaned it to a friend and never got it back :-(). This camera is inferior to the olympus in so very many ways. The controls are awkward. It doesn't come with a printed manual. The seal needs to be replaced on a yearly basis. It seems to have a short battery life. Everytime you turn it off, it forgets all the options you had set. If I could return it I would, but it has taken me more than 30 days to realize how much I dislike it. I have other Fuji's before, so it is not just that it is "different". Yuck.

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof!!
Reviews.Author: ABF "ABF"
Reviews.Content: Wish I had never bought this thing! This was somewhat of an impulse buy, as I had not researched the camera before purchase; got it at Costco. I was pretty psyched about the waterproof feature, since we spend a lot of time at the pool and in the water. I also liked the fact that it takes HD video. Once I got the camera home, I read the reviews about this camera not being waterproof enough, and I thought, "oh those people probably did not read the directions about making sure the battery flap was securely shut." WRONG! The very first time I took this camera out into the water, I made double and triple sure the battery flap was securely closed and snapped tight. It took pictures for about 10 minutes and then boom, a red light started flashing and that was it. Dead camera. When we got back home, I opened the battery flap up and sure enough there was water in there. So now I have a dead camera.As to picture quality (pre-death of camera), the outdoor pictures were fine/average compared with my previous Cannon, but definitely not better, notwithstanding Fuji's 14MP where my old Cannon was like 8MP. The indoor pictures absolutely sucked, all the time, every time. I messed with the settings numerous times to try and improve the quality, but the flash and settings never could get it right. All the indoor pics look blurry, overly orange, and improperly flashed, no matter where I was indoors. The HD video was really the only redeeming quality of this camera; the video always turned out nice for us, although the mic was placed oddly so that a person's finger would be almost 100% guaranteed to cover it as they took video. Also, the lens placement has a tendency to get in the way of fingers.Overall, I regret buying this 100%. It was one hundred fifty dollars wasted.  Would not even recommend if you never plan to take it in the water. Next time I will be doing my research before I buy!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera If You Experiment
Reviews.Author: Stephen
Reviews.Content: I have this camera in green and love it. I also have an XP10 which seems to be a different animal. Anyway, take the advise from the poster about closing the battery door to hear a loud click. Sometimes you will hear two clicks, one soft and one loud. Then it should be waterproof. As far as image quality, I noticed that the images had burned out highlights. In other words, the camera is not properly exposing. Just engage the exposure compensation and go down one third of a stop (-1/3). Leave it on full time and you will love your photos.

Reviews.Title: I like it.
Reviews.Author: Coty
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great one. I have tried a couple waterproof cameras before and this is by far the best. I bought this one to upgrade from my nikon d-40, yes, upgrade. It takes great pictures as long as you kinda know what you're doing... people complain about this camera's quality a lot on here, but I can guarantee you, if you use it right and take the time to familiarize yourself with it, it will do you wonders.

Reviews.Title: Very good pics But Camera is not Indistructible Fuji support may be failing
Reviews.Author: Michael L. Loren
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Cozumel and used the Camera on the beach and underwater.  It worked fine without any problems. The pic quality was very good. Underwater movies were especially sharp.  The important issue with this camera is it is definitely mechanical and has potential flaws. And we have to be just as careful with this camera as we would be with one that is not "waterproof, shockproof, and dustproof." This camera will likely break like most cameras if you drop it on concrete.  Fuji said it was tested being dropped on plywood. I'm figuring most of us will be near pool areas and plywood is not the typical flooring to drop this camera on. It should do great falling on grass or carpet.  This camera is definitely not shockproof, dustproof or waterproof. One might argue that it is "resistant" rather than proof.The main problem is with the battery flap door. Appearance and lock function appear marginal.First off I was having problems with closing the battery flap. Water needs to be removed from the body of the camera and around the battery door before opening the battery door. Any sand or dust that is near the lock mechanism may interfer with opening or closing the door.  Consider that sand/dust may get lodged in the locks and shutter, speaker, and battery seal and God knows what else and make the camera likely to fail.The underwater pics/movies were easy to take.  The underwater pics especially movies were fantastic.  It was very easy switching from single photo to movie mode.Fuji happened to mention deep into the CD manual that the battery door seal will need to be replaced every year. I guess the seal deteriorates and makes the camera less waterproof- and fails?  I wasn't anticipating this additional suprise expense/hassle. I called an authorized repair center they could not give me a cost for this and the Fuji offical consumer phone routing hell was nonfunctional and I was not able to speak to a person.Overall In the short two weeks I have had the camera, it worked very well.  However there are doubts set in my mind about the long term durability of this camera and Fuji support.  Support from Fuji seems mediocre.  I bought the camera from Costco and intend to return it.Finally I was attracted to this camera because of the simplicity of a single camera that can be used for snorkling.  It might make sense using an existing camera that already takes good pictures and find a more durable plastic housing- they are available and may offer more "definite" protection.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't last
Reviews.Author: Scott T. Melvin
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a trip to Mexico.  I read the manual fully and followed the directions.  Yet, it leaked the third time in the water, which effectively ruined the camera and any more chances for pictures the rest of the trip.  I did not go too deep or keep it in the water too long - more than 2 hours.  Maybe Fuji meant two hours total.  Very disappointing.I spoke to another man taking pics in the water at Tulum.  He was using an Olympus.  He said the same thing happened to him with a Fuji camera after just two times in the water.  Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: watch the door.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "posypusher"
Reviews.Content: beware the flimsy door to the battery. one must make sure it is firmly closed or water will leak into the camera compartment.

Reviews.Title: Survived Tough Mudder like a champ!
Reviews.Author: Rene
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I bought this at Costco to take pictures going through the 13 mile obstacle course in Tahoe.I went swimming with this camera, took it through mud and snow, it got dropped on multiple occasions and banged against rocks, and had no problems.Towards the end I ran into a problem with it focusing, but after power cycling it, it was fine. The lens did get scratched a bit, but didn't cause any distortion in the pictures, and considering how banged up it got, it held up extremely well.I did not try taking pictures underwater like other people said, but I honestly would not expect it to do extremely well, as the flash is equivalent to a disposable camera (which don't work well in the water unless it's crystal clear). The audio worked just fine for videos, and I didn't have any issues with water seepage like others have reported, however with serious consistent wear and tear I don't think any camera would hold up for too long.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Omar Zambrana Rivera
Reviews.Content: Item was exactly as described. Takes great pictures and tough too. Night pictures are kind of hard but once you work out the kinks they look good as well.

Reviews.Title: The worst
Reviews.Author: darien Ripple
Reviews.Content: The camera did not last one snorkel trip...on the boat trip out to the reef other travelers suggested that they had heard of others that experienced the camera leaking...but,Fuji FinePix XP20 ~ 14 Megapixel Digital Camera, Orange I figured why buy an underwater camera if you were not going to use it...big mistake...no photos of Belize

Reviews.Title: Can't believe there is a camera this bad
Reviews.Author: tewpo
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my wife to back up our Canon D10. The Canon is great. We have had other Fuji cameras and they have all been outstanding so we figured let's give the xp20 a try (in spite of the poor reviews) Well folks, this time all the bad reviews are dead on. This camera is real junk. The images are so smeared and noisy they are unusable. I bought my son a toy 4 meg camera about 6 yrs ago and even that takes better pictures. We tried different cards, experimented with different light and settings and nothing but trash. I really find it hard to believe in today's ultra competitive market that Fuji would allow this kind of crap to bear its name. It really is that bad. No color rendition even close to original. What is Fuji thinking? If you want the best rugged point and shoot, go with the Canon d10. It doesn't have HD (unfortunately) but its stills are fantastic. And even its non-HD movie format is quite good. The Fuji movies also stink. So I beg you, skip this Fuji piece of crap. Even the low end Kodak PlaySport is considerably better. Down with Fuji for putting this trash on the market!

Reviews.Title: Want a camera that will ruin your photos??? Look no further!
Reviews.Author: J. H. "lleeggss"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Fuji XP20 because I wanted a point and shoot camera that was waterproof and that would take good photos above the water too. I must say that in bright sunlight this camera takes a decent picture. But if you want to take any pictures inside or in not midday sun then forget this hunk of crap. No matter which setting I used the indoor pictures were always blurry. Unless the object was absolutely still. And I mean bowl of fruit still. The shutter was painfully s-l-o-w. We'd push the button to take a picture, then yell, "Hold it!" and wait for what felt like an eternity for the picture to take. People were rolling their eyes as we apologized for our "new" camera. MY IPHONE 4 TAKES BETTER PICTURES!!! My Canon SD 600 Elph that is 5 years old takes better pictures! Even with the flash the object can still be blurry and was often overexposed. Retailers should be embarassed to sell this camera. I returned this crapepr to Target and went to Best Buy to buy an Olympis. I told the employee not to let anyone buy the Fuji XP200 that they also carry. She said that they get many, many returns on this one. If your going to buy this cheap camera then make sure whoever you buy it from has a good return policy. Don't say you weren't warned!

Reviews.Title: Water resistant, not waterproof.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: From the manufacturer’s web site: “Water proof : IPX8 (up to 5m, within120min.)”I am 2 for 2 with this camera. First one became water logged while in my pocket in a water park (never went more than 3’ under the surface and not for more than about 15 min. I got it replaced, and assumed that since battery door does not latch completely closed by itself I might not have had it firmly closed. However I was careful not to submerge the replacement which worked well for outdoor activities (backpacking, hiking, skiing, etc) where it was exposed to dirt and moisture. Then during a family trip to Cancun Mexico, after taking a few underwater pictures (about 1’) seemed to do no harm, I again put it in my pocket (double checking that the battery door was firmly latched) during a trip floating in a water park (again never it never got more than 3’ under the surface)…when I got out the camera was full of water and it was dead.I define “waterproof” as being able to be completely submerged by water to a significant depth (~10’) for a significant time, while water resistant as able to withstand high moisture levels, splashing and brief shallow submerging (such as dropped in a sink and immediately removed). In my experience this camera does not warrant my definition of waterproof nor the manufacturer’s specification.Used as a durable water RESISTANT camera it functioned well; easy to use, good image quality and some nice features, hence 2 stars instead of 1. The primary driver for my rating of this camera is that I believe the label of Waterproof to be misleading at best. I would NOT recommend this product, if only for the misleading marketing, and will replace it with a camera not made by Fujifilm.

Reviews.Title: Picture Perfect
Reviews.Author: FM "FM"
Reviews.Content: This has been a great little camera to use for inclement weather and especially underwater photos and video.  Don't forget to buy a spare battery though.

Reviews.Title: Poor Choice
Reviews.Author: Ed in Georgia
Reviews.Content: I needed a waterproof/shockproof point and shoot to carry on my motorcycle.  The Fujifilm XP20 seemed to be a logical choice.  Wrong! Pictures are fuzzy. Color is off. In fact it looks like sepia tone when taken indoors. Focus is slow. And my finger keeps getting in front of the lens.  It may be waterproof although other reviews cast some doubt on that claim. Maybe I drop it in the bottom of a pannier and forget it unless the Sony DSC WX150 craps out during the upcoming Alaska trip.  The little Sony takes clear, well focused pictures equivalent to my full function Canon under most conditions.  I'll just slip it in a ziplock bag if it rains. I still can't figure how Fuji went so wrong with those 14 Megapixels. I've got an old 2 MP Nikon that takes much better photos.

Reviews.Title: Finally figured out the Panoramic setting
Reviews.Author: J Lott
Reviews.Content: Because I wasn't careful enough underwater, this is like my 3rd one of these, I use it ALL the time

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Jenny Salyers
Reviews.Content: Great photos and the camera has taken a beating.  The camera has never failed me.  I would buy another in a heartbeat.  My sister and daughter have both purchased this camera after my recommendations and they are equally pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: JHA "John"
Reviews.Content: Very durable and excellent picture quality combine to make this camera a great value. Make sue that the battery/memory card door is properly secured before liquid exposure. I would definitely buy this again.

Reviews.Title: Captured!
Reviews.Author: Nolan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera last summer, and to my amazement, it has worked very well as a photo shot camera and a video camera, under water and above water.  It still works just as well as when I first purchased it!  I purchased a camera once before for under water usage, and it bombed out on me big time as soon as I used it in my pool.  When I purchased this camera, I put it to the test thinking that I would have to return it for breaking down on me as soon as I got it wet like the previous "water proof" and "under water usage" camera I purchased.  WRONG!!!  It really, really works under water, and it works fantastically!  In fact, the pictures are so clear under water that when I did not see the blur like the previous camera I was overwhelmed with disbelief.  The pictures were actually clear!  If this is not true for others who purchased this same camera, then I must have been fortunate to get one that was actually made correctly to do what was stated in the website.  Now I use it a lot for various other projects, and in spite of all the bumping and dropping it has gone through and thanks to the carrying case it comes with, it looks like it just came out of the box like the day I received it.  I highly, very highly, recommend this particular camera because it is not difficult to use; it is not bulky nor requires many accessories like those cameras I considered purchasing to get excellent shots; it has automated focus that I can turn on and off real easily.  There are times when I want to capture facial features when shooting pics of people I know or like, and this "Smiley" feature is apparently a new technology for me.  I have no clue how it is able to function so accurately.  Anyway, all in all, I give seven stars out of five for my camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: It's an easy camera to use.  The size of the camera is great.Very small and easily taken wherever you go.

Reviews.Title: Fuji cameras are NOT waterproof
Reviews.Author: g2
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this camera, you will be sorry like myself and many others. This camera died in the swimming pool - standing in the shallow end. Battery door came open. This camera failed to operate as promised. Fuji customer support is not much better. Gave me a repair estimate higher than the price I paid for the camera.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Purchase
Reviews.Author: customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after my XP10 Fuji busted its screen after 1.5 years of being in my pocket. After 2 weeks of owning this XP20 camera the 4 way toggle button got stuck to the right, causing the camera to sometimes toggle between the screens after turning it on. I have to swap out the battery every 2-3 days because it keeps turning on after having it in the same pants that I wore with my XP10. I have taken pictures, come back to my office and the pictures are not on the SD card. Sometimes it will show a duplicate photo after a second picture has been taken. Meaning picture one taken, picture two taken, then it will show picture one once again on the SD card. Sometimes a newer model is not always your best choice to purchase.

Reviews.Title: it is not water resisant
Reviews.Author: Bret Hegmann
Reviews.Content: The first Time I went snorkeling with this camera and it leaked and stopping working.  no camera for my vacation and that sucked.  i will never but a Fuji film camera again.

Reviews.Title: Worst rugged camera I have every used...
Reviews.Author: stevec
Reviews.Content: I have used quite a few waterproof digital cameras (olympus, sony, and other fujifilm models), and this is the worst one I have used.  The camera worked which is a plus, but unfortunately the picture quality was horrible, I am talking about indoor, outdoor, underwater, you name it the pictures were awful.  Also the doors on this for the battery & card etc, were flimsy and would pop open which isn't reassuring.  The button layout also wasn't comfortable and felt that I was always having trouble adjusting the settings.I would stay away from this camera, or at least get a different camera for non underwater/rugged shots, as this isn't a great option.

Reviews.Title: Highly recommended
Reviews.Author: hikermama
Reviews.Content: I have recommended this camera and the previous xp10 to as may people I know that are wanting to buy a new camera. The best feature I like is that the lens is self contained so when you are zooming in and out there are no mechanical parts to become jammed with dust or sand and quit functioning. This is a problem I have had with several other cameras and have replaced many because of it.I bought one for my pre -teen son. He has used it underwater many times and it works great. I have even used one in hot springs( not recommended in owners manual) and it worked great. Of course, use common sense, make sure all compartments are closed properly and pounding surf is probably not a good idea. It doesn't claim to be bombproof.All pictures seem to be clear and crisp to me. Learning the different flash functions can eliminate the yellow type indoor photos that some talk about.In general , the best and most long lasting digital cameras I've had, have been Fujis'

Reviews.Title: too many malfunctions
Reviews.Author: Tom Hudson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a relatively inexpensive camera for snorkeling photos.  The quality of the photos was fine but the second day of snorkeling, the menu went crazy and would cycle through all of the menu options over and over.  I couldn't select any menu option so I couldn't take any more photos.  After many weeks at the Fujifilm repair shop I picked up the camera and it took decent photos until my next snorkeling trip.  Apparently, when the repairs were made, the water tight seals were not properly installed and the camera flooded.  It has been back in the shop for two months and I doubt it can be repaired.  I would like a refund but I doubt that will happen either.If I could start over, I would pay more and get a better camera. If you should buy this model, I recommend that you don't take it in water.

Reviews.Title: Far from Water proof
Reviews.Author: TheBigD
Reviews.Content: Secound time out snorkling it leaked stuck in roatan honduras two more weeks without a camara. water proof(NOT)the rubber seal is pathetic now dried salt water on the inside of lens its going back.Fujifilm FinePix XP20 Green 14 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD

Reviews.Title: Poor Build Quality - NOT Waterproof
Reviews.Author: John MacDonald
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of believing the advertising of this camera as waterproof.  I was suspicious on first use when the door over battery and memory card didn't seem to be a tight fit.  Fine print in manual limits time you can keep under water - another bad sign.  First camera leaked after about 2 hours in shallow pool.  Returned to Fuji for replacement/repair.  Second camera lasted about 1 hour in salt water.  Picture quality before it died was fair at best.  Look to another brand.

Reviews.Title: Flooded the second time I used
Reviews.Author: Daniel Branco
Reviews.Content: I took great pictures with the camera the first time I snorkeled with it. Second time was in a pool and it just flooded right away. Once could see water moving inside the camera, around the LCD screen and lens. Manual says it is supposed to support 5 meters (16 ft) depth for 120 minutes. Forget it. It can only handle being cleaned with water, at most.

Reviews.Title: Waterlogged
Reviews.Author: M. Sanders
Reviews.Content: Took some really great underwater pictures; but 3 days into using it, the lcd screen filled with water, and then it stopped working.  At least I was able to get the pictures off the sd card....  Trying to get refund/replacement.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera ever!!
Reviews.Author: Othoniel Diaz Rivera "vorikua"
Reviews.Content: This camera sucks! I used only 2 times and it stop working and damage my SD card with all my pictures!!! don't buy this cheap camera!

Reviews.Title: Worked great...Until it died 4 days later
Reviews.Author: a reader
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a trip to Kauai and very pleased with the quality of the photos and video...until the camera stopped working after 4 days. I carefully followed all instructions, but the camera died just in time to miss the most incredible once-in-a-lifetime photo op. Very disappointed! This model should not be sold as waterproof, since it became waterlogged after just a few snorkeling outings. But Amazon handled the return quickly and easily. 5 Stars to Amazon. 0 stars to Fuji.

Reviews.Title: won't turn back on after 6 months of minimal use
Reviews.Author: Steve P. Bobosky
Reviews.Content: I'm really disappointed in my fujifilm XP. I've used camera's by Canon, and Nikon. I was interested in the Fuji because it was waterproof. We used it once in a swimming pool. It was fine for about a month after that. Recently I wanted to use it again when we were going skiing and the camera won't turn on at all, regardless of trying a second battery. Avoid this camera, and if you do buy it... keep your receipt and proof of purchase so you can return it or warranty repair it. Ours was a gift, so its just a brick now.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Camera Guy
Reviews.Content: Don't put much trust in the camera being waterproof nor in Fuji's customer service. The first time I took this camera into a swimming pool I was able to get two pictures about 3 ft underwater before the camera died.  It was right before a vacation to Australia and knowing the camera would not be repaired in time I bought a Pentax WG-1. It performed a little better, I was able to get about 10 pictures under about 5 ft of water before it died.When I returned I sent both cameras back for warranty repair. Pentax sent me a new camera within two weeks. Fuji sent a refurbished one that didn't work back to me in about 2 months. I'm still waiting for them to respond with something that actually works.

Reviews.Title: Leaked after the first use
Reviews.Author: Randy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for use on a snorkel trip to have in addition to the Fujifilm XP10 that I already own.  Long story short, this camera leaked after about an hour of use.  Started shutting down in the water, and when I opened it up to see if the battery needed to be swapped, the inside had considerable water in it.  The doors were tightly closed.  This is in contrast to the XP10, which has worked fine for two snorkel trips.  See my review of it for more details.Fujifilm FinePix XP10 12 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: pdrew
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera just once and I liked it. In terms of the quality of the picture, it is good, I had Olympus waterproof camera before and I can really compare the quality of pics, Fuji waterproof camera is better. One more thing, they have different colors to choose.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm WP Camera
Reviews.Author: CinBad
Reviews.Content: The video in and out of water is good, the underwater still shots are great, and the out of water still shots are grainy.  I'm not too impressed with the quality pictures out of the water.  Over all I am content with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Jane
Reviews.Content: This camera is truly waterproof, if you keep any moisture away. It takes great pictures, if you suffer from Macular Degeneration. It is indestructible, if you don't take it out of the box and is a TRUE value, if you're a tool.

Reviews.Title: NOT waterproof
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for exactly 1 month when it leaked.  It had only been used in a pool 3 times.  No children were permitted to use it in a pool. The camera leaked in the pool causing the pictures to turn purple, and the lens to fill with water.  The LCD screen developed condensation which eventually cleared, and the camera did dry out except for the lens unit which was left with a big water mark circle.  The camera would turn on occasionally after, but would not take any pictures and the LCD screen would scroll through the menu screen over and over.  Luckily I had kept the receipt and purchased the extended warranty.  Target not only refunded the purchase cost of the camera, but also the cost of the warranty.  Kudos to Target (Uniontown, PA), for their customer service, not so much to Fuji for their poor quaity camera.  The thing is I liked many of the camera features.  I was looking for a durable camera to put up with a little wear and tear.  I think my cell phone camera has put up with much more and probably took equal quality pictures!

Reviews.Title: the vendor never shipped it
Reviews.Author: nancy nogay
Reviews.Content: It was an unreliable vendor.  Hope you are not using them anymore.  It never shipped to us.  You sent an email advising us of this.  But I had to go to another vendor and that delayed getting the camera.

Reviews.Title: Could be better
Reviews.Author: jujulachelle
Reviews.Content: Fujifilm FinePix XP20 Green 14 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCDThe camera is slow to take pictures and sow to turn on. It takes okay pictures.
